name: Tourism in San Diego Quiz | California | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT located in San Diego County?
questions.explanation:
Mission San Juan Capistrano.

	The mission is in Orange County, about 10 miles north of San Diego County.

questions.text: This 'island', which is not really an island but a peninsula, is home to one of the highest-income areas in San Diego County. It is the location of a famous landmark affectionately known as the 'Hotel Del'.
questions.explanation:
Coronado Island.

	The Hotel Del Coronado is the famous landmark. Fiesta and Shelter Islands are manmade islands in San Diego and Mission Bays. Catalina is off the Los Angeles coast.

questions.text: What segment of the tourist and entertainment industry is the fastest-growing in San Diego County?
questions.explanation:
Indian gaming and casinos.

	Due to the passage of several initiatives that have lifted restrictions on the types of games found in Indian gambling emporia, new casinos are sprouting up all over. As of 2000, San Diego already has three, all of which are expanding, and three more are in the works. An update- in 2009, San Diego has 13 casinos with still more being planned.

questions.text: What toy company opened a major attraction in San Diego County in 1999?
questions.explanation:
Lego.

	Legoland, San Diego's theme park, is located in Carlsbad, about 20 miles north of downtown San Diego.

questions.text: People travel for miles to see something growing in Carlsbad, in North San Diego County. What is it?
questions.explanation:
Flowers.

	Carlsbad is a major flower-growing center. You can see poinsettias in the winter and bulbs-especially ranunculus- in the spring.

questions.text: What is the Mexican border town that is directly south of San Ysidro in San Diego County?
questions.explanation:
Tijuana.

	The city of Tijuana has a population that is as large as the city of San Diego.

questions.text: The birth of what kind of animal caused a great stir at the San Diego Zoo in 1999?
questions.explanation:
Giant panda.

	People lined up for hours to see the famous baby Hua-Mei.

questions.text: This destination is the most-visited National Monument in California.
questions.explanation:
Cabrillo Lighthouse.

	Juan Cabrillo made his first anchorage in California here. The site has a historic lighthouse built in 1880, tidepools, and great views. Migrating gray whales can be seen here.

questions.text: What San Diego mountain town with a gold prospecting past is famous for its apple pie?
questions.explanation:
Julian.

	You can tour defunct gold mines in the area. Idyllwild and Big Bear are in San Bernadino County.

questions.text: Bonus  for San Diego mavens! A trip to the town mentioned above is not complete without a stop at a bakery in Santa Ysabel, famous for its cheese and date-nut-raisin breads.
questions.explanation:
Dudley's.

	A place known by all San Diego insiders.
